frontmatter.title: The First Drop: Introducing AdoptOpenJDK Quality Assurance (AQA) v1.0
frontmatter.description: AdoptOpenJDK Quality Assurance (AQA) is a curated set of open tests that we run against our release builds at AdoptOpenJDK. These tests assess whether a binary meets the high quality standards expected by enterprise customers.

frontmatter.title: Jumpstarting Open Performance Testing
frontmatter.description: Before I dabble in the juicy world of computer architectures and measuring and understanding performance implications, let me premise this entire post with a quick introduction to myself.

frontmatter.title: JCK Certification and An Anniversary of Sorts
frontmatter.description: Exactly a year ago today, Tim Ellison sent me a note.  He had just watched a presentation I had recorded, talking about the work my team had started to vastly 'simplify Java testing'.

frontmatter.title: Testing Java: Help Me Count the Ways
Playing with Test Microservices
frontmatter.description: Recently, I had the good fortune to speak (fondly!) about some excellent open-source projects that I participate in... AdoptOpenJDK, Eclipse OpenJ9 and Eclipse OMR.  Across those three projects, we are trying to simplify the activity of testing.

frontmatter.title: Testing Java: Let Me Count the Ways
frontmatter.description: For years now, I have been testing Java and if there is a single statement to make about that activity, it is that there are many, many, many ways to test a Java Virtual Machine (JVM).
